result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan T Macholl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
CORRECTED 07-20-2017:  Apply 1 day sentence credit.
Probation may be transferred to County of residence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Restitution to be determined at future hearing.

No Contact with the victim. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: FIRST 90 days are Straight Time. Balance are Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. May be served in the County of defendant's residence.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 4/21/16 Plea hearing, filed by Cheryl Humpal.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 9/26/16 Sentencing transcript , filed by Cheryl Humpal.

Defendant Ethan T Macholl in court with Attorney John Schiro.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Victim makes statements. Attorney Schiro makes statements regarding sentencing.  Anna M. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court orders that any submissions regarding restitution are to be filed by December 27, 2016.  Restitution hearing to then be set, if necessary.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

 2  1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (1 day credit)
  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS   -  May be transferred to county of residence 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:  VICTIM 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  to be determined - Restitution hearing requested

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted - ($1,500.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  10 MONTHS, 1st 90 Days straight time, remainder Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.  May be served in county of Defendant's residence. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Ethan T Macholl in court with attorney George David Kidd.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Village of Menomonee Falls Sargent Michael Douglas sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Bayer.  Cross examination by Attorney Kidd.  Village of Menomonee Falls Officer/Evidence Technician Erich Uebersohn sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Bayer.  Cross examination by Attorney Kidd.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense moves to dismiss.    Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
